translations.translation: roasting in a red-hot Fire,
Burning in the scorching fire,
they shall burn in a Scorching Fire;
They will suffer the heat of the blazing fire
(Yet) Going into the blazing fire.
They will enter into Fire, Hamiyah.
Entering into burning fire,
roasting at a scorching fire,
Scorched by burning fire,
they shall enter a burning Fire
They shall roast into the scalding Fire,
they will enter a scorching fire
The while they enter the Blazing Fire,-
They will enter in the hot blazing Fire,
roasting at a scorching Fire
Roasting in a scorching Fire.
They will [enter to] burn in an intensely hot Fire.
[88:4] roasting (read taslā or tuslā) in a scorching fire,
(Scorched by burning fire) they enter the Fire whose heat is extreme,

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: عن أبي خالد عن زيد بن علي عليهما السّلامُ في قولهِ تعالى: { تَصْلَىٰ نَاراً حَامِيَةً } معناه حَارةٌ { تُسْقَىٰ مِنْ عَيْنٍ آنِيَةٍ } معناه حَارةٌ قَد انتهى حرُّها

translations.translation: This is a reference to the verse in the Qur'an where Allah says "They will enter a blazing Fire." The word "blazing" here refers to a fire that is so hot that it has reached its maximum heat.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
{ تَصْلَىٰ } وتطرح حينئذٍ { نَاراً حَامِيَةً } [الغاشية: 4] في نهاية الحر والحرقة
 تأكيداً وتشديداً لعذابها


{ تُسْقَىٰ } عند إشرافها على الهلاك من شدة العطش { مِنْ عَيْنٍ آنِيَةٍ } [الغاشية: 5] متناهية في الحرارة
 وكيف لا
 قد أوقدت حولها نار جهنم منذ خلقت
 هذا شرابهم
